snippet: A day after they left thousands of Boston schoolchildren stranded, drivers were back, but schools warned parents to be ready with contingency plans in case of another walkout.
abstract: School bus drivers return to work in Boston after a surprise daylong work stoppage that left thousands of schoolchildren stranded; drivers have complained about changes in payroll administration and in their health care plan, as well as a new GPS system.

byline.original: By KATHARINE Q. SEELYE and JESS BIDGOOD

lead_paragraph: A day after they left thousands of Boston schoolchildren stranded, drivers were back, but schools warned parents to be ready with contingency plans in case of another walkout.

headline.main: Boston School-Bus Drivers Return to Work Amid Uncertainty
headline.print_headline: Massachusetts: Boston Bus Drivers Return to the Road
